summary: Cork is Ireland's second-largest city, located in the province of Munster. With a population of over 224,000 (2022), it's a significant place on the island. The city is situated on an island between two River Lee channels. Cork has a rich history, dating back to a 6th-century monastic settlement, later expanded by Viking invaders. It received its charter in 1185. Known as "the rebel city," Cork has a rebellious past, supporting the Yorkist cause in the Wars of the Roses and opposing the Anglo-Irish Treaty.
title: Cork (city)
